intro: Eupatorium cannabinum, commonly known as hemp dogbane, is a flowering plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of small, white to pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and can reach heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and often have a hairy texture. The plant is also known for its historical use in traditional medicine and as a source of fibers.
